slides.title: Motion and Force
slides.content:
**Newton's Laws:**
1st: Object at rest stays at rest
2nd: F = ma (Force = mass × acceleration)
3rd: Action = Reaction

**Motion:** Distance, Speed, Velocity, Acceleration
**Speed = Distance/Time**

slides.title: Energy
slides.content:
**Types:** Kinetic (motion), Potential (position), Heat, Light, Sound, Electrical
**Law:** Energy cannot be created/destroyed, only converted
**Work = Force × Distance**
**Power = Work/Time**

slides.title: Light and Sound
slides.content:
**Light:** Travels in straight lines, Speed: 3×10⁸ m/s, Reflection, Refraction
**Sound:** Needs medium, Speed in air: 343 m/s, Echo, Frequency (Hz)
**Applications:** Periscope, mirrors, SONAR (Navy uses for submarines)

question.questionText: What is the SI unit of force?
question.explanation: Newton (N) is the SI unit of force, named after Sir Isaac Newton. 1 Newton = 1 kg⋅m/s²
